NanoObjectDetection.handle_data module¶

Created on Tue Feb 5 12:23:39 2019

@author: Ronny Förster und Stefan Weidlich

This module take care about reading, writing, changing and simple analysis of the rawdata

ARHCF_HexToDiameter(side_length)[source]¶

Calculates the inner and the other radius of hexagon side_length: list or array with the six side length

DispWithGamma(image, gamma=0.5, display=False)[source]¶

gamma correction of an image

GetTrajLengthAndParticleNumber(t)[source]¶

Searches for the particle with the longest trajectory Save particle ID and trajectory length t: trajectory

GetVarOfSettings(settings, key, entry)[source]¶

Reads the variable inside a dictonary settings: dict key: type of setting entry: variable name old function - should no be in use anymore

Get_min_max_round(array_in, decade)[source]¶

Get the minimum and maximum of an array rounded to the next decade This can be useful to get limits of a plot nicely (does not end at 37.9 but at 40) decade: precision of np.round eg.: decace = -2 –> round to 100, 200, 300, … eg.: decace = +3 –> round to 3.141

LogData(rawframes)[source]¶

Log of input

NormImage(image)[source]¶

normalize an image to [0;1]

ReadData2Numpy(ParameterJsonFile)[source]¶

Reads the images in distinguishes between:

tif_series tif_stack fits

Reads a fits image in

Reads a tiff series in

ReadTiffStack2Numpy(data_file_name)[source]¶

RotImages(rawframes_np, ParameterJsonFile, Do_rotation=None, rot_angle=None)[source]¶

Rotate the rawimage by rot_angle

SpecificValueOrSettings(try_value, settings, key, entry)[source]¶

Check if a specific value is given. Otherwise the one out of the settings is used

Arg:
try_value: if existing, that one is used an written in the settings
UseROI(image, ParameterJsonFile, x_min=None, x_max=None, y_min=None, y_max=None, frame_min=None, frame_max=None)[source]¶

Applies a ROI to a given image

UseSuperSampling(image_in, ParameterJsonFile, fac_xy=None, fac_frame=None)[source]¶

Supersamples the data in x, y and frames by integer numbers e.g.: fac_frame = 5 means that only every fifth frame is kept

WriteJson(mypath, settings)[source]¶

Writes the current settings to a json file mypath: path to the json file settings

are_rawframes_saturated(rawframes_np, ignore_saturation=False)[source]¶

Check if rawimages are saturated. This is done by looking if the maximum value is 2^x with x an integer which sounds saturated e.g. if the max value is 1024, this is suspicious

max_rawframes(rawframes_np, display=False)[source]¶

Maximum projection along the frames display if wanted

mean_rawframes(rawframes_np, display=False)[source]¶

Calculated the mean along the frames display if wanted

min_rawframes(rawframes_np, display=False)[source]¶

Minimum projection along the frames display if wanted

percentile_rawframes(rawframes_np, percentile, display=False)[source]¶

Calculated the percentile along the frames display if wanted

total_intensity(rawframes_np, display=False)[source]¶

tot_intensity: total intensity in each frame rel_intensity: relative intensity with respect to the mean can be used to remove laser fluctuations
